Dinoysius. Of Alexandria; son of Glaucus. Grammarian. From Nero onwards he was a companion of the emperors until Trajan. He was director of the libraries, and was secretary with responsibility for correspondence, embassies and rescripts. He was the teacher of the grammarian Parthenius, and a pupil of the philosopher Chaeremon, whose successor he was in Alexandria.
